hints.content:
When we add a number, we jump that distance to the right on the number line.

To show $\blueD{9}$, we need to show $\maroonD{1}$ jump of $\blueD{9}$ units.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 9 with tick marks at 0 and 9. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick mark at 9. The arrow is labeled plus 9. !

hints.content:
This number line best represents $1\times 9$:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 9 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick mark at 9. !

choices.content: ![A number line labeled 0 to 10 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 1 and 10.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/442d039e189faa1beeba9472f307a931ad4cce7d)

![A number line labeled 0 to 10 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 9 and 10.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e6b9b799a68a044a3899a2fbba6182f9b9a8e9f9)

![A number line labeled 0 to 9 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick mark at 9.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c2952d85811e38d98fe6dc9460d19d46c6aa5c9e)
